Reviews.Title: No iPhone but very good smartphone for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Maung
Reviews.Content: I have an iPhone and used to have some kind of Samsung smartphone (I wanted to be deviant and try Windows Phone only to realize Apple knew what they were doing and Windows just isn't good enough for what I need even though phone was excellent and I did like some aspects of Windows system). I bought this Cubot phone because it's unlocked and has two SIM card slots (hey...I'll probably never use both at same time but two is better than one, right?) and a memory card slot (given that they don't provide much memory space on the phone at all). I like the look of it, and it also stated it can be a wireless hotspot, which is what I may need for where I'll be using this phone. So, I bought this phone to use in Myanmar (and perhaps other countries I'll travel in if I do get to travel more). I have not tried in Maynamr yet (which is in Southeast Asia, if you are not familiar with world geography). But I've tried in Canada briefly so I can comment on that experience.It came in beautiful packaging and got all it needed-phone, charger, USB cord, earphones, gel case and of course, battery. Relatively easy to take off back cover to install battery and SIM card and memory card. It is somewhat lightweight plastic for the cover but it doesn't look cheap and won't break at slightest touch. However, I can't say it's built to withstand major destruction. I'm talking about the back cover here.Front face came with a plastic screen liner that has a little label to inform you to take it off after set up. I was worried if I take it off, there won't be a screen protector and wasn't sure if the glass is that sturdy to withstand  scratches, but I took it off anyway and found out a screen protector is already placed underneath that top liner so that's wonderful.The touchscreen is quite sensitive, sometimes a little too much but I rather have that then not at all. Although there is one corner at lower right that seems a bit hard to respond to touch. It's no big deal except when updating apps and you've to press "accept" to agreements and the icon to accept so happens to be at that corner.Screen image quality is good. It's not iPhone with its retina display and all that but you really can't tell too much of a difference at all. Camera is so-so. I tried at night with lights on so it might be that. Maybe it's better in daylight. I don't know as I haven't taken pictures in daylight yet. It's not horrible photo. It's better than those initial old school cell phone cameras (remember those flip phones and when it was a big deal to have email just started on those basic phones?). You won't be able to send your photos to National Heographic, that's all I'm saying. Otherwise, it really is not bad.It's user friendly enough and works like any other Android operating system (I have a Samsung galaxy tablet that uses Android). I downloaded and installed apps through wi fi and it was fast enough. I will suggest closing down apps when not using to reduce drag on RAM which sometimes can slow system down and freeze or crash apps, I think. I'm no tech genius but that sort of what I've heard or learned/applied based on my computer usages. You can do this by pressing home icon down for a couple seconds till view do various ongoing apps show up and you just swipe to delete. I think the list icon, which should be the lines icon to the left also does same thing. Sometimes I wonder if people complain about crashes without realizing this issue. I don't think it solves all crashes. Sometimes it's just bugs in app, and sometimes it's just the operating system, and sometimes the phone/device doesn't have sufficient capacity.I did call myself using my iPhone just to test it out (and to test my international SIM card out) but I hung up on myself since I didn't want waste minutes on the prepaid card. At least it rings so that part works. I can't comment on sound quality of call.All in all, I'm pleasantly surprised. I wasn't sure what to expect given its $99 for a smartphone that's unlocked. But it's a travel phone and I didn't want to spend hefty amount for something I'll use only for at most a month out of each year. But it is important to me to be able to have ways of communicating via calls and emails and internet while traveling. I don't need anything fancy but just the basic smartphone. If you are looking for that, then do consider this phone as it's such a great deal. If I have different experience after I come back from. Y Asia trip, I'll post any updates. But if I don't, that means I'm enjoying my phone. I wrote this long because I really do think this phone deserves a good review. I researched and compared a few phones online before I got this.

Reviews.Title: This is my Second Cubot, and so far So Good.  The first Cubot was 2G only and was very slow with Internet.
Reviews.Author: AJMV "AJMV"
Reviews.Content: This Cel. phone is 3G, Wi-Fi, 5 mpx camera etc. etc.Definitely, this is a very very good Smartphone at a very good price.  I works just like the Galaxy III and feel just as good.Best of all it can handle 2 sims and it is very well thought out.  It is like having 2 Galaxiy III Smart Phones.The touch pad is very fast and bright. I know there must be some difference somewhere, but I still have not fout out what it is.This Smart Phone comes for half the price of the Galaxy III and solves the problem for people that have a Company Phone anda Personal Number.

Reviews.Title: NICE ANDROID PHONE
Reviews.Author: Mr. Terence J. Dalton
Reviews.Content: I am not phone savvy but I do like this item which has a very competitive price. Unfortunately the first one I received had a problem with the back cover not fitting properly, but the supplier tried to assist me with this and when it did not work out, changed the phone immediately. As I said I am not very up on smartphones, and this unit would be better if it had a full start up and settings guide, instead of a fast start booklet.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: Bethany Ayars
Reviews.Content: The only draw back is it did utilize 3g in my area. So make sure it is compatible before you buy! The bright side is SEVESTO, the seller, gave me a complete refund very quickly and were easy to deal with. The phone performed great. Very fast and not alot of bloatware (apps that most ppl will not even use taking up space) and plenty of storage. There are rooting tools but no custom roms as of yet.

Reviews.Title: definitely worth it
Reviews.Author: Andrea Tincher
Reviews.Content: It was everything the website said it was. I love this phone. Picture quality is awesome and it's quick with the internet.

Reviews.Title: Everything but Picture Messaging
Reviews.Author: Gemini87
Reviews.Content: I can not send or receive picture messages. I gave it a 3 because the main reason I needed a phone was for better pictures and messages for work. Everything else has been OK. I've had the phone for 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: TONIA   CHILDS
Reviews.Content: I suggest this phone to individuals looking to buy a good quality phone. It can be used by any carrier.

Reviews.Title: cubot GT90
Reviews.Author: betty56
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old granddaughter love this phone You have to order a sims card though. She like the fast downloading.

Reviews.Title: good smartphone
Reviews.Author: Emiliano
Reviews.Content: since I bought for couple month ago  is working good so far only the camera does not take good picture  with flash lightthe picture is dark .i take on dark room no imagine

Reviews.Title: Great Little Phone
Reviews.Author: David King
Reviews.Content: Large enough to read, small enough for a pocket.  Works well.  Bought one for my wife and one for me.

Reviews.Title: Beautifull phone
Reviews.Author: Edgar J. Rodriguez O
Reviews.Content: a cell not very common but very nice features has a beautiful design and its functions are very good I really like this phone really is a good invention

Reviews.Title: Cubot GT90
Reviews.Author: Alain Danel "AFD"
Reviews.Content: Very nice device. However, the battery does not last long enough. Five hours max, this is not good  and I tried to find large battery for it, but no success.The GT99 has a 2200mah battery, but nobody could confirm that it would work in the GT90.Useless phone for me if battery does not get 8 hours +

Reviews.Title: malfunctioning
Reviews.Author: Recaldo Brotherson
Reviews.Content: I like this phone but it seems that the problem stemmed even before I bought it. After i received this phone i was excited. However, once I started downloading apps it started to malfunction; turning on and off by itself, making weird noises at start up and having line and rainbow colours on the screen etc. next, it told me that there was a virus, I quickly removed the apps and restored it to its factory settings. However, it seems to have gotten worse: I cant seem to use it for more than 3 minutes and playstore tells me avast and other antivirus aren't available where i live although avast is on the PC. I am really confused and frustrated. PLEASE HELP!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed customer
Reviews.Author: Cami Keyser
Reviews.Content: I received the phone and my daughter very excited to get and it was just what she wanted until we found out that is was not compatible with Verizon.  I ended up getting her phone fixed and getting a free phone from Verizon so we had to return the other phone. I took the steps to return the phone and sent it UPS all the way back to China to get a phone call from UPS stating there was an additional free of $43 dollars and they were refusing to pay after I already paid about $123 to send it back. I told the lady on the phone that I did not want the phone, but I did ask if there was a fee to return it back to me and of course there was and I told the lady I do not want it, therefore it was left abandoned at the site. I will never by anything from them again!!!!!!  it was a waste of money and money I did not have to waste!!!!!!!  very disappointed..this is the first time I have been extremely disappointed in something i have bought from amazon.

Reviews.Title: lacamara no funciona
Reviews.Author: francisco del pozo
Reviews.Content: a design that you love fine termination and suffered a great disappointment because the front camera is one of its most imprecionantesofertas just does not work.although there is no physical mind can see no apps nor free nor sees pay or be enabled.

ProductInfo.Features:
Android 4.2 : This Android smartphone is a brilliantly constructed piece of hardware merged with the Google Android 4.2 to provide end users with amazing modern day functionality on the go for their daily communication and entertainment needs.
Storage: It is 4 GB of built-in storage, but you're free to expand that storage capability by up to 32 GB TF card (micro SD memory card). Simply slide an TF card in and enjoy photo slideshows, music playback, and even video playback!
GPS:Find your way with the smartphone's built-in GPS, which doesn't need Wi-Fi or 3G/4G to operate.
WIFI: The built-in WiFi in this smartphone supports WiFi 802.11b/g/n to make it easy for users to Check emails, Connect online, Downloads or Surf the Web with advanced WIFI technology.
Dual Camera:With a 5.0MP Front Camera and 8.0MP Back Camera with flashlight and auto focus,the smartphone make it possible to enjoy the video chat and taking pictures whenever you want and need.
ProductInfo.Name: Cubot GT90 4.0 Inch 3G Android 4.2 MTK6572 Dual Core Dual SIM Smartphone 5.0MP Camera 4G ROM Mobile Phone GPS Cellphone WIFI (White)
